title: Eight-hour water cut in Colombo and suburbs today
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced an eight-hour water supply interruption affecting several areas in Colombo and its suburbs today (20) .

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department states that several spells of showers will occur in the Eastern, Uva, and Central Provinces and in the Polonnaruwa and Hambantota Districts.

title: Eight elephants killed as Rajdhani Express collides with herd in India’s Assam
byline: At least eight elephants were killed and one calf injured after a herd collided with the Sairang-New Delhi Rajdhani Express in Assam’s Hojai on Saturday morning, leading to disruption of rail services.

title: US carries out large-scale retaliatory strikes against ISIS in Syria
byline: The U.S. military launched large-scale strikes against dozens of Islamic State targets in Syria on Friday in retaliation for an attack on U.S. personnel, U.S. officials said.

title: World Bank approves US$ 50M project to support Sri Lanka’s digital transformation
byline: The World Bank Board of Executive Directors has approved a US$50 million project to support Sri Lanka’s digital transformation.

title: Suspect arrested with heroin worth over Rs. 6 mln in Panadura
byline: The Panadura South Police Division has arrested an individual in possession of a stock of heroin valued at over Rs. 6 million.

title: Gazette issued revising expressway user fees in Sri Lanka
byline: The Government has issued new regulations amending the National Thoroughfares (User Fee) Regulation No. 1 of 2021 under the provisions of the National Thoroughfares Act, No. 40 of 2008, as published in a recent Gazette Extraordinary.

title: Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan and wife sentenced to 17 years in corruption case
byline: A Pakistani accountability court on Saturday sentenced jailed former prime minister Imran Khan and his wife Bushra Bibi to 17 years imprisonment each in the Toshakhana 2 corruption case.

title: BASL urges President to strengthen RTI Commission amid funding and staffing concerns
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) has written to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake urging urgent action to address challenges faced by the Right to Information (RTI) Commission.

title: President thanks UAE for ongoing flood relief in phone call with UAE President
byline: UAE President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan has received a phone call from President of Sri Lanka Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who expressed his appreciation for the UAE’s continued humanitarian assistance to communities affected by recent floods and heavy rainfall in Sri Lanka.

title: Trump urges 2028 astronaut moon landing in sweeping space policy order
byline: President Donald Trump enshrined the U.S. goal to put humans back on the moon by 2028 and defend space from weapon threats in a sweeping executive order issued on Thursday, the first major space policy move of his administration’s second term.

title: Over 100 flights cancelled at Delhi airport due to dense fog
byline: More than 100 flights were cancelled at Delhi’s Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport on Saturday due to dense fog affecting visibility across North India.

title: ‘Udarata Menike’ runs first train in 23 days as Badulla–Ambewela line reopens
byline: Train services on the Badulla–Ambewela section of the Upcountry Railway Line officially resumed this morning (20), following extensive repairs to damage caused by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: UK author David Walliams dropped by publisher after harassment allegations
byline: David Walliams, a bestselling British children’s author, was dropped by HarperCollins UK on Friday after the Daily Telegraph reported the publisher had investigated claims that he had harassed some of its junior female employees.

title: 36 major reservoirs across Sri Lanka continue to spill - Irrigation Dept
byline: The Irrigation Department has reported that 36 major reservoirs and over 52 medium-sized reservoirs across the country are currently spilling due to prevailing weather conditions in Sri Lanka.

title: Indian pharma company requests int’l testing of controversial drug withdrawn in Sri Lanka
byline: The Indian pharmaceutical company involved in the recent drug controversy, ‘Maan Pharmaceuticals’, has formally requested Sri Lankan health authorities to have the drug in question tested by an internationally accredited laboratory.

title: Special security measures deployed for festival season – Sri Lanka Police
byline: Sri Lanka Police have announced enhanced security arrangements across the country ahead of the Christmas festival season.

title: Showers expected in several provinces tomorrow
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Eastern, Uva and Central provinces and in Polonnaruwa and Hambantota districts tomorrow (21), according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: Landslide warnings issued for several districts extended
byline: The National Building Research Organization (NBRO) has further extended the ‘Level-3’ (Red) landslide evacuation warning issued for several areas in the Kandy and Nuwara Eliya districts.

title: Vegetable prices rise sharply after crop damage across Sri Lanka
byline: Recent adverse weather conditions in Sri Lanka have destroyed numerous farmlands, leading to a sharp increase in vegetable prices across the country.

title: Sri Lankan Parliament announces extended holiday for MPs and staff
byline: The Parliament of Sri Lanka has announced an extended recess for Members of Parliament and parliamentary staff.

title: Loan relief measures revealed for disaster-affected businesses
byline: The Minister of Labour and Deputy Minister of Finance and Planning, Dr. Anil Jayantha Fernando, has explained a comprehensive set of loan relief measures aimed at supporting individuals and businesses affected by the recent disaster situation across the country.

title: ‘Public Assistance Service Centre’ to be established at Galle Face for festive season
byline: A special Public Assistance Service Centre will be established at the Galle Face premises from tomorrow (21) to ensure the safety and convenience of the public visiting the area during the festive season.

title: Bangladesh holds state funeral for slain youth leader amid tight security
byline: Tens of thousands of Bangladeshi mourners, including the country’s interim government leader, attended the funeral on Saturday of a slain youth leader and election candidate amid tight security.

title: Over 800 arrested in island-wide anti-drug raids
byline: A total of 846 suspects have been arrested within yesterday (19) in island-wide raids conducted under the theme “Nation United – National Drive”, aimed at eradicating narcotics from the country.

title: District-level plans reviewed under ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ programme
byline: A special review meeting was held today (20) at the Presidential Secretariat to assess district-level plans implemented under the ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ programme and to examine challenges encountered in restoring public livelihoods.

title: Epstein files release highlights Clinton, makes scant reference to Trump
byline: The U.S. Justice Department released thousands of heavily redacted documents related to the late financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein on Friday that made scant reference to President Donald Trump but extensively featured Democratic former President Bill Clinton.

title: President directs to complete allowance payments to disaster victims before Dec. 31
byline: A special discussion was held today (20) at the Presidential Secretariat under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake to review district-level plans aimed at restoring the lives of citizens under the ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ programme and to examine challenges that have emerged during implementation.

title: CBSL Governor on public’s duty to properly manage and utilize disaster relief funds
byline: The Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe says that the public should be very mindful when obtaining relief money and bank loans provided by the government for those affected by the disaster.
